li.span: Coronavirus (COVID-19) Response Plan

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

p.span: ISD 728 will take direction from the Minnesota Department of Health (MDH) and Minnesota Department of Education (MDE) involving COVID-19. ISD 728 has primary responsibility for the health and safety of its students and employees in school. Therefore, ISD 728 will react swiftly and decisively to assure the good health and safety of those individuals if the need arises.

span.p: This plan for addressing any COVID-19 incident is intended to serve the best interests of students, employees and families in the remote event of an incidence or threat of the Coronavirus infecting an Independent School District (ISD) 728 student, employee, volunteer or a family member.

p.span: Sunday, March 15, 2020 Governor Walz and Minnesota Department of Education Commissioner Ricker informed Minnesotans about school closures due to the COVID-19 outbreak. In accordance with those recommendations, ISD 728 will be closing schools starting Monday, March 16 until further notice.
Between March 16 and March 27, 2020, ISD 728 school officials and staff will create and finalize plans for distance learning for our students, which will begin March 30, 2020.

span.p:
ISD 728 Childcare for Emergency Personnel
Please contact the Community Education office to inquire on childcare availability. Call 763-241-3544 or emailedventureclub@isd728.org.

p.br: For translation of this website click here, and select the language.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

h1.aria-label: Food Service: FREE Grab n' Go Meals
h1.span: Food Service: FREE Grab n' Go Meals

div.p: ISD 728 will continue to offerGrabnGoStylemealsfor all families to drive through and/or pick-up curbside on the dates indicated on thiscalendar.Mealsare being provided at no cost to families, for each child age 18 and under.The Grab n Go style meal will provide lunch for the current day and breakfast for the following day.

li.span: Pick up breakfast and/or lunch.
1 breakfast and 1 lunch is available for each child.
Meals will be placed on carts for families to take while in their car.
Meals cannot be consumed on-site.
Meals are pre-packaged to facilitate efficient pick-up with minimal exposure.
Meals are designed for pick-up only through curbside delivery at this time.
The following items are not available: infant formula, baby food, or other personal care items such as diapers, toiletries, etc.

p.br: Service will continue on the dates listed on thiscalendar, or visitwww.isd728.org/Grab-n-Go-Calendar.

div.p:
PICK UP LOCATIONS
Pick up will be from 11:00 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. at the following sites:

li.span: 600 School Street, Elk River, MN 55330
25959 4th Street West, Zimmerman, MN 55398
12220 80th Street NE, Otsego, MN 55330
21000 141st Avenue, Rogers, MN 55374

p.span: Click here to view a map of the locations.
Students can go to any of the above-mentioned locations regardless of the school they currently attend to pick up meals.
If your child requires specific dietary needs or you have additional questions, please contact Michelle Jones, Food Service Manager, via emailmichelle.jones@isd728.orgor by phone at (763) 241-3409.

div.div: Additional family food options can be found here.

div.span: Parents from any school can go to
Grab n' Go Meals to have their district-issued device repaired or replaced

span.br:
600 School Street, Elk River, MN 55330
Door 2

li.span:
Zimmerman Elementary School
25959 4th Street West, Zimmerman, MN 55398
Door1 (flagpole entrance)

span.br:
12220 80th Street NE, Otsego, MN 55330
Main Entrance

div.span: Pick up will be from 11:00 a.m. to 1:30 p.m.

span.br: Fill out this formand a tech specialist will contact you during business hours 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. Monday through Friday.Phone support is also available at 763-241-3490.

ul.li:
Parents and students will have access to get personal supplies (i.e. empty out desks and lockers, gather medications, etc.) onTuesday, March 17, 2020.
This will allow ISD 728 staff to clean the facilities in accordance with guidance from the Department of Health. Principals will send specific details and additional guidance regarding scheduled pick-up times. Contact your school if you cannot make it or have additional questions.

Families with elementary-aged children who need to request a device for distance learning can check one out on Tuesday, March 17, 2020 at their childs school. If you have a device at home your child can use, you may use it instead of checking out a school-issued device.

School officials ask that families limit the time they spend in school when picking up supplies due to social distancing guidelines and to prevent the spread of the virus (i.e. 10 minutes or less). School officials also recommend limiting the number of people they bring with them when picking up supplies (i.e. one parent/guardian).

div.p:
What are Distance Learning Days
The goal of Distance Learning is to continue students conceptual understanding and skill development. Students participating in Distance Learning will receive course expectations, class announcements and learning objectives in a digital format. Students will participate in a variety of activities, but not all will be digital in nature. The communication below will provide more specific guidance related to Distance Learning days. Thank you for your support as we implement this new process. Your efforts are greatly appreciated! If you have questions, please contact your child's teacher.
Instructional Delivery
Beginning on Monday, March 30, 2020 by 9:00 a.m., staff will communicate course/class expectations using the following:

li.span: E-2 students will utilize Seesaw as the primary delivery method for class content. Refer to the
page for further information. Accommodations will be made for students with IEP or 504 plans.
3-12 students will utilize Schoology as the primary delivery method for class content.Refer to the
page for further information. Accommodations will be made for students with IEP or 504 plans.

p.br: Attendance is based on work completion per week (a week constitutes Sunday through Saturday). Staff will record attendance the Monday after the previous week. Students must complete at least one required assignment per week to be considered present. Assignments may include, but are not limited to the following:

ul.li: Discussion Post:Students contributing to or responding to an online discussion prompt.
Assignment:Students submit an assignment in Seesaw / Schoology or other digital means.
Test/Quiz:Students submit a digital test or quiz.

p.span: Please know that your child will continue to receive special education services, accommodations, and modifications as outlined on their current Individualized Education Plan (IEP) or Individualized Family Service Plan (IFSP).How these services will be provided may look different. For example, starting March 30, 2020, services will be delivered through an alternative method that may include technology, phone calls, and/or printed resources.

Your childs case manager will be in contact with you by the end of the day March 27, 2020 and will discuss your childs Individualized Distance Learning Service Plan. This will be an addendum to your childs IEP. Please let your childs case manager know if you need access to a device or internet. We will work closely with you and try to accommodate your childs needs.

div.p:
Hosting Live Video Conferencing Sessions
Google Meet will be one of the primary video conferencing tools used to host live class sessions in communication with students during Distance Learning Days.If your child is unable to attend a live session, the classroom teachers will provide a recorded version of the video conference.

ul.li: In some instances, teachers may host a synchronous (live) class experience via Google Meet. In order to avoid conflicts with other classes, staff will use the times below when scheduling synchronous (live) sessions.
When possible, staff may record these sessions and publish for students to watch at a later time.
Refer to these tutorials that describe how to join a video conference usingGoogle MeetorSchoology.
E-5 Teachers will post daily expectations in Seesaw or Schoology by 9:00 a.m.
6-12 Teachers will post daily expectations in Schoology by 9:00 a.m.
The expectation is for all staff to be available by email or phone (via voicemail) from 9:00 a.m. - 11:00 a.m. and 1:00 p.m. - 3:00 p.m.

Staff will respond to all communication requests in a timely manner (within 24 hours) during scheduled hours via phone (Google Meet) or email. Teachers may communicate outside of office hours as needed.

div.p:
Contacting your child's teacher on a Distance Learning Day
Teachers, principals, and other licensed professionals will be available by email or phone (via voicemail) from 9:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. There are two (2) ways you can contact your childs teachers:

ol.li: Send staff an email to their school email address. Staff contact information can be found in theISD 728 Staff Directory.

Call your childs teacher and leave a message on their school voicemail.All voicemails are forwarded to staff members email. If you request a call back from your child's teacher, please leave your phone number and a specific time for a return call.

div.p: Staff will respond to all communication requests in a timely manner (within 24 hours) during scheduled hours via phone (Google Meet) or email. Teachers may communicate outside of office hours as needed.

Google Meet Phone Calling
Teachers will utilize Google Meet Internet Calling if there is a need to call parents on a Distance Learning Day. As a recipient of a Google Internet Call, the incoming number will have a number and Caller ID from out state.

span.strong: Student Access to My ISD 728 Rapid Portal

p.br: You can accessMy ISD 728 Rapid Portalatmy.isd728.orgto access familiar classroom resources, including apps for distance learning. To help prepare for Distance Learning beginningMonday, March 30, 2020, please help your child practice logging into the above website. These apps are available from most internet connected devices available in your home, or optionally from a school issued Chromebook you connect to your home internet.

div.p: Students may not be familiar with their login information or how to navigate to the Rapid Portal and will need your helping hand, especially for Grades K-2. The next few days will be an opportune time to get your student(s) familiar with this process.

strong.a: See Rapid Portal Student Login Directions

div.p:
Parent Technical Support & Access to Devices
Needs help using class materials or websites?
Please contact your teacher for help by sending an email or leaving a voicemail. It may take a day to hear back.

Need a chromebook or replacement device?
Parents from any school can go to buildings offeringGrab n' Go Meals. Pick up will be from 11:00 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Call (763) 241-3490 ahead of time to help us be ready.

li.span: 600 School Street, Elk River, MN 55330
25959 4th Street West, Zimmerman, MN 55398
12220 80th Street NE, Otsego, MN 55330
21000 141st Avenue, Rogers, MN 55374

div.p:
ChromeDepot Online
Having trouble connecting to wifi? Unable to sign in tomy.isd728.org?Other issues? Grade K-5 Parents and Grade 6-12 students or parents can call (763) 241-3490 or visitwww.isd728.org/LetsChatfor assistance. Support is available 8:00 a.m.- 4:00 p.m. M-F.

Internet Filtering at Home
To help protect students against harmful and inappropriate online material, as well as to keep a scholarly focus when learning online, ISD 728 uses online services provided by GoGuardian. This web-based protection operates both when in school and at also at home for school managed accounts (i.e. when a student is logged into Chrome or a Chromebook with their school email address). Visitherefor more information about what is filtered.

While filtering takes place both at school and at home, parents play an important role in supervising their child's internet access and usage. Parents are encouraged to discuss rules for appropriate internet usage, and reinforce lessons of digital citizenship and safety. Please review our technology responsible useguidelinesand visitwww.isd728.org/Digital-Health-Wellnessto learn more about available parent resources.
We also highly encourage reporting any potential cyberbullying or other sensitive issues by visitingwww.isd728.org/Bullyingand using the provided Reporting Forms.

Before March 30th, parents will receive information about accessing the newGoGuardian Parent Appto see which websites, apps, and extensions a student uses, and to see how often teachers have issued intervention commands, like locking screens or closing tabs.

Teachers are limited to usingGoGuardian Teacherwith students in their classes during instructional hours, helping them assess students progress towards class assignments and facilitating communication between teachers and students during class time.

School administrators and assigned IT staff receive real time Smart Alerts if a student views explicit content. They can also access toGoGuardian Adminto review flagged or blocked activity and reports.

p.strong: Visit the ISD 728 Covid-19 Resource Website for Additional Information:

div.p: We know that your schedules are wide and varied. We are here to support you and your child during these evolving times, so please reach out to us as we are in this together.

Sincerely,
Dr. Jana Hennen-Burr
Assistant Superintendent of Educational Services

div.div: EdVenture Club programming will be canceled Monday, March 16, 2020 and Tuesday, March 17, 2020. All registrations starting Monday, March 16, 2020 for before and after school care will be canceled and refunds will be processed.
Starting Wednesday, March 18, 2020 through Friday,May1, 2020, childcare will be provided per the Governor's recommendation to Emergency personnel critical to the State's response to COVID-19:

ul.li: Childcare will be provided for healthcare, emergency medical services, long-term and post-acute care providers; law enforcement personnel; personnel providing correctional services; public health employees; firefighters and other first responders; essential court personnel, as well as for ISD 728 employees who will be planning, providing instruction, and/or supporting essential functions within the organization.
Emergency personnel requesting childcare during this time will be required to provide an employer ID or another form of employee identification when dropping their child off at the site.
Registration will be for Monday-Friday enrollment from 7 a.m.- 5 p.m. for NO COST.
There will be no fees for childcare from March 18 through April 9, 2020.
A maximum of 30 children, ages 6 to 12, will be allowed to enroll atavailable sites.
A maximum of 10 children, ages 3 to 5,will be allowed to enroll atavailable sites.

div.span: Please contact the Community Education office to inquire on childcare availability. Call 763-241-3544 or email

p.span: A great resource for learning about this year's AP Exams is Trevor Packer's presentation (

li.span: Only students who are currently registered for AP exams will be allowed to participate in the AP tests this spring. No additional registrations are allowed.
Students who are registered for an AP exam who are unable to take the exam should contact their AP teacher.
Exams will be given from May 1122.
Students who are unable to take their test on the designated day must work with their buildings AP Coordinator to schedule a makeup test, which will be offered from June 15.
Students can take exams at home or in schools, if they reopen.
Each subject's exam will be taken on the same day at the same time, worldwide.
View the full testing schedule (

p.span: Most exams will have one or two free-response questions, and each question will be timed separately. Students will need to write and submit their responses within the allotted time for each question.

li.span: Students will be able to take exams on any device they have access tocomputer, tablet, or smartphone. They'll be able to type and upload their responses or write responses by hand and submit a photo via their cell phones.
For most subjects, the exams will be 45 minutes long, plus an additional 5 minutes for uploading.
Students will need to access the online testing system 30 minutes early to get set up.

Certain coursesArt and Design: 2D; Art and Design: 3D; Art and Design:Drawing; and Computer Science Principleswill use portfolio submissions and will not have a separate online exam. All deadlines for these submissions have been extended to May 26, 2020, 11:59 p.m. ET. Teachers and students may receive separate course-specific communications.

Students taking world language and culture exams will complete two spoken tasks consistent with free-response questions 3 and 4 on the current AP Exam. Written responses will not be required. The College Board will provide additional details in the coming weeks to help students prepare.

p.span: Tips for testing on specific devices will be available in late April.

As usual, students' work will be scored by a network of college faculty and AP teachers, and will be reported on a 15 scale. The College Board anticipates releasing scores as close to the usual July timeframe as possible.

The College Board is confident that the vast majority of higher ed institutions will award college credit as they have in the past. They have spoken with hundreds of institutions across the country that support their solution for this year's AP Exams.

Like many college-level exams, this year's AP Exams will be open book/open note. The exam format and questions are being designed specifically for an at-home administration, so points will not be earned from content that can be found in textbooks or online. However, students taking the exams may not consult with any other individuals during the testing period. The College Board will take the necessary steps to protect the integrity of each exam administration, as they do every year.

We're confident that the vast majority of AP students will follow the rules for taking the exams. For the small number of students who may try to gain an unfair advantage, the College Board has a comprehensive and strict set of protocols in place to prevent and detect cheating. While some of these practices are confidential to maximize their effectiveness, students and education professionals can learn more about our security measures (

At a minimum, test takers should understand that those attempting to gain an unfair advantage will either be blocked from testing or their AP scores will be canceled, and their high school will be notified as will colleges or other organizations to which the student has already sent any College Board scores (including SAT scores). And they may be prohibited from taking a future Advanced Placement Exam as well as the SAT, SAT Subject Tests, or CLEP assessments.

On March 25, the College Board began offering free live AP review courses, delivered by AP teachers from across the country. The courses have been viewed more than 3.2 million times since they became available. On-demand lessons (
) are now available for Art and Design, AP Capstone, and Computer Science Principles.

In addition to sharing information about these classes with students, teachers who are providing remote instruction can use AP Classroom for most subjects. The College Board has unlocked secure free-response questions in AP Classroom so teachers can digitally assign relevant practice questions students can take at home. Additional tips
for helping your students practice are available(click here).

The College Board has added frequently asked questions to their website so you can find answers to important topics, including information for students with accommodations, details about exam fees and cancellations, credit and placement, calculator policies, and more. (
) Additional updates will be shared through email, online educator communities, and social media.
If you have questions about the new AP tests, please contact your childs AP teacher or you can contact the AP Coordinator for your childs school.
Rachel Telfer
p.a: rachel.telfer@isd728.org

p.span: Shane Noecker
Tom Kish

div.p: MCA/MTAS tests for the 2019-2020 school year have been canceled.

The district-provided ACT test that was scheduled for March 23, 2020 has been canceled.Juniors will be provided with an opportunity to take the ACT, free of charge, on October 6, 2020.The October 6, 2020 administration will happen during the school day.

There are two national ACT test dates this summer, June 13, 2020 and July 18, 2020. Theseopportunities are not part of the district assessment program so standard ACT fees will apply.Please see theACT websitefor more information about these testing opportunities. Please beaware that the registration deadline for the June 13, 2020 administration is May 8, 2020.

ul.li: Conferences:
Elementary: Conferences have been canceled.
Secondary: Conferences have been canceled.

Community Education Early Childhood Family Education programs, Early Childhood Screening, Youth Enrichment, Arts and Recreation, Drivers Education, Adult Enrichment & Fitness classes scheduled through May are canceled. Participants will be provided credit for future programs.
School Readiness and ABE participants will receive communication about Distance Learning options that will start on March 30, 2020.
Please take time to review your contact information on Infinite Campus Parent Portal to ensure it is accurate.

Continued communication from the District will be done through the parent notification system and will be posted on the Districts website www.isd728.org/COVID-19. We will also post information and links via our social media channels on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.

The Minnesota State High School League provides guidance related to athletics/activities. Effective Monday, March 16, 2020, there will be no practices, scrimmages, games, etc. through at least March 27, 2020 (MSHSL).
The ACT exam scheduled for March 23, 2020 is canceled. We are working with ACT to move the date for those that are registered for the test.

span.strong: What if my student is on an IEP or other special education program?

p.br: Families with students on an IEP or other special education program will be contacted by a representative from the District no later than March 30, 2020 to make arrangements.

span.strong: How will the District handle cases in which families opt out of technology?

p.br: ISD 728 will be working with these families to determine an appropriate plan of action.

span.strong: Where can I get wifi if I do not have it?

p.br: ISD 728 will be working with area partners and will provide information as soon as it is available.

span.strong: Will the district be providing transportation for childcare?

br.span: Transportation will only be provided for children attending sessions during regular school hours. Transportation will be provided to the nearest available school site. Only one pick up and drop off location will be allowed.

span.strong: My student(s) was signed up to take the ACT? What happens now?

p.br: The ACT exam scheduled for March 23, 2020 is canceled. We are working with ACT to move the date for those that are registered for the test.

span.strong: Will my high school hold their junior/senior prom?

p.br: We will continue to inform you, through our channels, about prom. As of now, gatherings of more than 250 are not recommended. We are following that guidance until instructed otherwise by MDH.

span.strong: What does this closure mean for graduation?

p.br: Quite simply, were not sure yet. We will, with the guidance of MDE and MDH, reassess the situation at that time.

span.strong: What does the closure mean for athletics?

p.br: The Minnesota State High School League provides guidance related to athletics/activities. Effective Monday, March 16, 2020, there will be no practices, scrimmages, games, etc. through at least March 27, 2020 (MSHSL).

Four County Crisis Response Team: 1-800-635-8008
The Trevor Lifeline (for LGBTQ youth): 1-866-488-7386

hr.p: If this is an emergency, please call 9-1-1 or go to your nearest emergency room.
If you are concerned about the safety of another individual, please call 9-1-1 immediately to arrange for help and support.

h1.aria-label: March 25, 2020: Superintendent Update: Shelter in Place
h1.span: March 25, 2020: Superintendent Update: Shelter in Place

p.span: Governor Walz has ordered that all Minnesotans shelter-in-place beginning at 11:59 p.m. on Friday, March 27, 2020 through April 10, 2020.
This means he expects Minnesotans to stay in their homes, only leaving for food, medicine, outdoor exercise, and to fulfill other essential services.

In addition, he has ordered distance learning to occur through at least April 30, 2020. The Governor has also ordered that all school staff report to work May 1, 2020 and May 4, 2020 to prepare for the return of students on May 5, 2020.
If and when different guidance is provided by the Governor, we will communicate it to our families through our parent notification system and website.

The Governor has been clear that he considers educational services to be essential to keeping our communities strong. As a former teacher, he understands the important role that we play and continues to expect that schools will provide things such as distance learning, childcare services, building maintenance, and food service, while maintaining district operations related to such things as finance, human resources, technology etc.

We recognize the virus that causes Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) is easily transmitted, especially in group settings, and it is essential that the spread of the virus be slowed to protect the ability of public and private health care providers to handle the influx of new patients and safeguard public health and safety.

Because of the risk of the rapid spread of the virus, the need to protect all members of the District and Community is essential. As a result and in order to prevent over-inundating of our healthcare systems, ISD 728 will be requiring all employees to stay at home except for those completing essential work related to childcare, food service, and District Operations beginning March 30, 2020 and until further notice.
Please continue to use the District website at www.isd728.org for the most up to date information. Feel free to contact me. I will continue to be available and present.

Thank you for being part of ISD 728, we will walk this journey together and will be stronger than ever when it passes.
Watch the Video
WatchISD 728 Superintendent Dan Bittman give an update on the Minnesota Shelter in Place order.
ISD 728 Parents:

What are Distance Learning Days
The goal of Distance Learning is to continue students conceptual understanding and skill development. Students participating in Distance Learning will receive course expectations, class announcements and learning objectives in a digital format. Students will participate in a variety of activities, but not all will be digital in nature. The communication below will provide more specific guidance related to Distance Learning days. Thank you for your support as we implement this new process. Your efforts are greatly appreciated! If you have questions, please contact your child's teacher.

strong.em: Beginning on Monday, March 30, 2020 by 9:00 a.m., staff will communicate course/class expectations using the following:

li.span: E-2 students will utilize Seesaw as the primary delivery method for class content. Refer to the Seesaw Parent Support page for further information. Accommodations will be made for students with IEP or 504 plans.

3-12 students will utilize Schoology as the primary delivery method for class content. Refer to the Schoology Parent Support page for further information. Accommodations will be made for students with IEP or 504 plans.

br.span: Attendance is based on work completion per week (a week constitutes Sunday through Saturday). Staff will record attendance the Monday after the previous week. Students must complete at least one required assignment per week to be considered present. Assignments may include, but are not limited to the following:

li.span: Discussion Post: Students contributing to or responding to an online discussion prompt.
Assignment: Students submit an assignment in Seesaw / Schoology or other digital means.
Test/Quiz: Students submit a digital test or quiz.

p.span:
Special Education
Please know that your child will continue to receive special education services, accommodations, and modifications as outlined on their current Individualized Education Plan (IEP) or Individualized Family Service Plan (IFSP). How these services will be provided may look different. For example, starting March 30, 2020, services will be delivered through an alternative method that may include technology, phone calls, and/or printed resources.

Your childs case manager will be in contact with you by the end of the day March 27, 2020 and will discuss your childs Individualized Distance Learning Service Plan. This will be an addendum to your childs IEP. Please let your childs case manager know if you need access to a device or internet. We will work closely with you and try to accommodate your childs needs.

Hosting Live Video Conferencing Sessions
Google Meet will be one of the primary video conferencing tools used to host live class sessions in communication with students during Distance Learning Days. If your child is unable to attend a live session, the classroom teachers will provide a recorded version of the video conference.

li.span: In some instances, teachers may host a synchronous (live) class experience via Google Meet. In order to avoid conflicts with other classes, staff will use the times below when scheduling synchronous (live) sessions.
When possible, staff may record these sessions and publish for students to watch at a later time.
Refer to these tutorials that describe how to join a video conference using Google Meet or Schoology.
E-5 Teachers will post daily expectations in Seesaw or Schoology by 9:00 a.m.
6-12 Teachers will post daily expectations in Schoology by 9:00 a.m.
The expectation is for all staff to be available by email or phone (via voicemail) from 9:00 a.m. - 11:00 a.m. and 1:00 p.m. - 3:00 p.m.

Staff will respond to all communication requests in a timely manner (within 24 hours) during scheduled hours via phone (Google Meet) or email. Teachers may communicate outside of office hours as needed.

p.span:
Contacting your Child's Teacher on a Distance Learning Day
Teachers, principals, and other licensed professionals will be available by email or phone (via voicemail) from 9:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. There are two (2) ways you can contact your childs teachers:

li.span: Send staff an email to their school email address. Staff contact information can be found in the ISD 728 Staff Directory.

Call your childs teacher and leave a message on their school voicemail. All voicemails are forwarded to staff members email. If you request a call back from your child's teacher, please leave your phone number and a specific time for a return call.

p.span: Staff will respond to all communication requests in a timely manner (within 24 hours) during scheduled hours via phone (Google Meet) or email. Teachers may communicate outside of office hours as needed.

Google Meet Phone Calling
Teachers will utilize Google Meet Internet Calling if there is a need to call parents on a Distance Learning Day. As a recipient of a Google Internet Call, the incoming number will have a number and Caller ID from out state.

span.strong: Student Access to My ISD 728 Rapid Portal

br.span: You can access My ISD 728 Rapid Portal at my.isd728.org to access familiar classroom resources, including apps for distance learning. To help prepare for Distance Learning beginning Monday, March 30, 2020, please help your child practice logging into the above website. These apps are available from most internet connected devices available in your home, or optionally from a school issued Chromebook you connect to your home internet.

p.span: Students may not be familiar with their login information or how to navigate to the Rapid Portal and will need your helping hand, especially for Grades K-2. The next few days will be an opportune time to get your student(s) familiar with this process.

strong.a: See Rapid Portal Student Login Directions

p.span:
Parent Technical Support & Access to Devices
Need help using class materials or websites?
Please contact your teacher for help by sending an email or leaving a voicemail. It may take a day to hear back.

Need a Chromebook or replacement device?
Parents from any school can go to buildings offering Grab n' Go Meals. Pick up will be from 11:00 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Call (763) 241-3490 ahead of time to help us be ready.

ChromeDepot Online
Having trouble connecting to wifi? Unable to sign in to my.isd728.org? Other issues? Grade K-5 Parents and Grade 6-12 students or parents can call (763) 241-3490 or visit www.isd728.org/LetsChat for assistance. Support is available 8:00 a.m.- 4:00 p.m. Monday through Friday.

Internet Filtering at Home
To help protect students against harmful and inappropriate online material, as well as to keep a scholarly focus when learning online, ISD 728 uses online services provided by GoGuardian. This web-based protection operates both when in school and at also at home for school managed accounts (i.e. when a student is logged into Chrome or a Chromebook with their school email address). Visit here for more information about what is filtered.

While filtering takes place both at school and at home, parents play an important role in supervising their child's internet access and usage. Parents are encouraged to discuss rules for appropriate internet usage, and reinforce lessons of digital citizenship and safety. Please review our technology responsible use guidelines and visit www.isd728.org/Digital-Health-Wellness to learn more about available parent resources.
We also highly encourage reporting any potential cyberbullying or other sensitive issues by visiting www.isd728.org/Bullying and using the provided Reporting Forms.

Before March 30, 2020, parents will receive information about accessing the new GoGuardian Parent App to see which websites, apps, and extensions a student uses, and to see how often teachers have issued intervention commands, like locking screens or closing tabs.

Teachers are limited to using GoGuardian Teacher with students in their classes during instructional hours, helping them assess students progress towards class assignments and facilitating communication between teachers and students during class time.

School administrators and assigned IT staff receive real time Smart Alerts if a student views explicit content. They can also access to GoGuardian Adminto review flagged or blocked activity and reports.

span.strong: Visit the ISD 728 Covid-19 Resource Website for Additional Information:

p.span: We know that your schedules are wide and varied. We are here to support you and your child during these evolving times, so please reach out to us as we are in this together.
Sincerely,
Dear ISD 728 Parents and Guardians:

As you know, March 25-27, 2020 was originally designated as Parent/Teacher Conferences for all ISD 728 Elementary Schools and Prairie View Middle School. Due to COVID-19, please see the following information regarding conferences and report cards.

li.span: ISD 728 will not hold conferences that were scheduled for March 25 - March 27, 2020.
If you have specific questions regarding your childs grades, please email your childs teacher.
Grades will be reflected based upon data gathered and recorded prior to March 16, 2020. This is the last date students were in session.
Report cards will be posted to the Parent Portal on March 30, 2020 and parents will receive notification after they have been posted.
Due Process Meetings: Any scheduled Due Process meetings (IEP, evaluations, etc.) that were to occur during our school closure or due to conferences will be rescheduled after March 30, 2020.
Due Process Paperwork: Progress reports will be completed by the end of the day on March 27, 2020 and will be sent to families via email.

p.span: Sincerely,

Dr. Jana Hennen-Burr
Assistant Superintendent of Educational Services

h1.aria-label: March 23, 2020: Important Update: Change In Food Service Delivery
h1.span: March 23, 2020: Important Update: Change In Food Service Delivery

p.span:
The District has been provided new guidance from the Minnesota Department of Health that social distancing needs to be maintained in all situations related to the delivery of food at our schools.
Effective TODAY Monday, March 23, 2020:

li.span: Food service staff will no longer be able to hand bags to you in your car.
Food will be placed on carts at the curb for families to take while in their car.
The flow of traffic at both Lincoln Elementary and Prairie View Elementary and Middle School sites will change based on the new practice and guidelines.

p.span: Thank you for your understanding and cooperation as we keep the safety of others as our top priority.

li.span: Pick up will be from 11:00 a.m. to 1:30 p.m.
Pick up breakfast and/or lunch.
1 breakfast and 1 lunch is available for each child.
Meals cannot be consumed on-site.
Meals are pre-packaged to facilitate efficient pick-up with minimal exposure.
Meals are designed for pick-up only through curbside delivery, at this time.
The following items are not available: infant formula, baby food, or other personal care items such as diapers, toiletries, etc.

span.br:
600 School Street, Elk River, MN 55330
Door 2

25959 4th Street West, Zimmerman, MN 55398
Main Entrance

12220 80th Street NE, Otsego, MN 55330
Main Entrance

li.span: Monday, March 23
Tuesday, March 24
Wednesday, March 25
Thursday, March 26

p.span: Again, pick up service hours are 11:00 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. at each site on the dates listed above. ISD 728 students can go to any of the above-mentioned locations regardless of the school they currently attend to pick up meals.

br.span: If your child requires specific dietary needs or you have additional questions, please contact Michelle Jones, Food Service Manager, via email michelle.jones@isd728.org or by phone at (763) 241-3409.

p.span: Please check our website often, www.isd728.org/COVID-19, for more information and regular updates.

div.span: WatchISD 728 Superintendent Dan Bittman give an update regarding COVID-19.

h1.aria-label: March 18, 2020: FREE Grab n' Go Meals
h1.span: March 18, 2020: FREE Grab n' Go Meals

p.span: Today, Wednesday, March 18, 2020, ISD 728 will begin offering the opportunity for all families to drive through and pick up FREE meals for their children 18 and under.
The Grab n Go style meal will provide lunch for the current day and breakfast for the following day.
Pick up will be from 11 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. at the following sites:

span.br:
600 School Street, Elk River, MN 55330
Door 2

25959 4th Street West, Zimmerman, MN 55398
Main Entrance

12220 80th Street NE, Otsego, MN 55330
Main Entrance

span.strong: Please stay in your car and meals will be brought to you.

p.span: Service will continue on the dates listed below:

li.span: Wednesday, March 18
Thursday, March 19
Friday, March 20
Monday, March 23
Tuesday, March 24
Wednesday, March 25
Thursday, March 26

p.span: Again, pick up service hours are 11 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. at each site on the dates listed above. ISD 728 students can go to any of the above-mentioned locations regardless of the school they currently attend to pick up meals.

br.span: If your child requires specific dietary needs or you have additional questions, please contact Michelle Jones, Food Service Manager, via email michelle.jones@isd728.org or by phone at (763) 241-3409.

p.span: Please check our website often,
www.isd728.org/COVID-19, for more information and regular updates.
Your student
has access to distance learning resources through their personal school account. Elementary family guardians received their student's username and password invia email.
Students will start at website
at
p.a: my.isd728.org
p.span: to access familiar classroom resources, including apps for distance learning to be detailed later next week. To help prepare for Distance Learning starting
, please help your student practice logging into the above website.

These apps are available from most internet connected devices available in your home, or optionally from a school issued Chromebook you connect to your home internet. School Chromebooks are available March 17, 2020 (today) during the scheduled personal belongings pickup times detailed in a prior email from your school.

Students may not be familiar with their login information or how to navigate to the Rapid Portal and will need your helping hand, especially for Grades K-2. The next few days will be an opportune time to get your student(s) familiar with this process.

Due to the recent Covid 19 virus outbreak, internet providers are offering free or low cost internet access to customers who may not have wifi available for their students. More information is available
p.a: www.isd728.org/HomeWifi

p.span: If you are new to caring for a school issued chromebook, review the Quick Start for care & cleaning guidelines as well basic troubleshooting:
p.a: www.isd728.org/QuickChromebook

hr.p: For help with navigating and using the device, review the Chromebook User Guide www.isd728.org/UsingChromebook.

p.b: Support, repair, & replacement options will be available prior to March 30, 2020, when Distance Learning will begin for students.

div.p: Sunday, March 15, 2020, Governor Walz and Minnesota Department of Education Commissioner Ricker informed Minnesotans about school closures due to the COVID-19 outbreak. In accordance with those recommendations, ISD 728 will be closing schools starting Monday, March 16, 2020 until further notice. While we recognize this is an inconvenience, the Department of Health has provided special direction related to social distancing, which cannot be implemented during the traditional instructional day (i.e. lunch, recess, passing in hallways, etc.).

Between March 16 and March 27, 2020, ISD 728 school officials and staff will create and finalize plans for distance learning for students, which will begin Monday, March 30, 2020. Written differently, students will be out of school and not receive instruction until March 30, 2020. On March 30, 2020, distance learning will begin and continue until further notice, which will be provided by the Department of Education and Department of Health.

Distance learning guidelines, which will operate similar to E-Learning Days implemented in the instance of a weather cancellation, will be communicated to families and students in the following days. Those in middle school and high school grades will utilize their current 1:1 technology (i.e. Chromebooks). The District will be working to equip families of elementary students with technology and activity boards. This plan will allow for daily interaction and academic progress.

ul.li: Parents and students will have access to get personal supplies (i.e. empty out desks and lockers, gather medications, etc.) onTuesday, March 17, 2020. This will allow ISD 728 staff to clean the facilities in accordance with guidance from the Department of Health. Principals will send specific details and additional guidance regarding scheduled pick-up times.

Families with elementary-aged children who need to request a device for distance learning can check one out on Tuesday, March 17, 2020 at their childs school. If you have a device at home your child can use, you may use it instead of checking out a school-issued device.

School officials ask that families limit the time they spend in school when picking up supplies due to social distancing guidelines and to prevent the spread of the virus (i.e. 10 minutes or less). School officials also recommend limiting the number of people they bring with them when picking up supplies (i.e. one parent/guardian).

div.p: EdVenture Club programming will be canceled Monday, March 16, 2020 and Tuesday, March 17, 2020. All registrations starting Monday March 16, 2020 for before and after school care will be canceled and refunds will be processed.
Starting Wednesday, March 18, 2020 through Friday, March 27, 2020, childcare will be provided per theGovernor's recommendationto Emergency personnel critical to the State's response to COVID-19:

ul.li: Childcare will be provided for healthcare, emergency medical services, long-term and post-acute care providers; law enforcement personnel; personnel providing correctional services; public health employees; firefighters and other first responders; essential court personnel.
Emergency personnel requesting childcare during this time will be required to provide an employer ID or another form of employee identification.

div.p: Specific site locations for childcare will be determined and communicated Tuesday, March 17, 2020. Registration will be for Monday through Friday enrollment from 7 a.m.- 5 p.m. for $125 per student per week. A maximum of 30 children, ages 6 to 12, will be allowed to enroll at a site to be determined. A maximum of 10 children, ages 3 to 5, will be allowed to enroll at an Early Childhood site to be determined. Enrollment limits are put in place to ensure the implementation of social distancing and best practice health strategies. A registration lottery will be available Monday, March 16, 2020 onwww.728communityed.comand an enrollment acceptance will be communicated to applicants Tuesday, March 17, 2020 by the end of the workday.

ul.li: For community childcare availability starting the week of March 30, 2020, ISD 728 will be communicating information to all families Monday, March 23, 2020.

div.p: In the coming days, parents will be provided additional information regarding school meal availability once details regarding the program have been finalized. School officials are working with the Department of Education and are waiting for guidance.

ul.li: Conferences:
Elementary: Conference information will be forthcoming
Secondary: Conference information will be forthcoming

Community Education Early Childhood Family Education programs, Early Childhood Screening, Youth Enrichment, Arts and Recreation, Drivers Education, Adult Enrichment & Fitness classes scheduled through May are canceled. Participants will be provided credit for future programs.
School Readiness and ABE participants will receive communication about Distance Learning options that will start on March 30, 2020.
Please take time to review your contact information onInfinite Campus Parent Portalto ensure it is accurate.

Continued communication from the District will be done through the parent notification system and will be posted on the Districts websitewww.isd728.org/COVID-19. We will also post information and links via our social media channels on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.

The Minnesota State High School League provides guidance related to athletics/activities. Effective Monday, March 16, 2020, there will be no practices, scrimmages, games, etc. through at least March 27, 2020 (MSHSL).
The ACT exam scheduled for March 23, 2020 is canceled. We are working with ACT to move the date for those that are registered for the test.

div.p: Answers to other frequently asked questions and more communication from ISD 728 leadership will be posted on the District website regularly atwww.isd728.org/COVID-19.
As additional information is made available through the Minnesota Department of Health and the Minnesota Department of Education, we will make it available through our stated communication channels.

The Coronavirus, COVID-19, situation throughout Minnesota, the United States, and World continues to impact all of us and is continuously evolving. ISD 728 will continue to follow the expert guidance from the Minnesota Department of Education (MDE) and the Minnesota Department of Health (MDH). At this time, the two departments - using guidance from the Center for Disease Control (CDC), continue to recommend that schools remain open. In addition, both organizations continue to stress common-sense illness prevention techniques such as staying home when sick, covering your cough, social distancing and using good handwashing techniques.

As ofMarch 13, 2020and per the Minnesota Department of Health and Department of Education, there are no confirmed cases within ISD 728 of students or staff contracting or having had direct exposure to COVID-19. Furthermore, the Department of Health stated there are no confirmed cases within Minnesota involving any school-aged child at this time.

ISD 728 leaders are committed to keeping students, staff and families informed about any new guidance received and information that becomes available. Based on guidance receivedMarch 13, 2020 from MDH, CDC, and MDE, ISD 728 will be implementing some preventative and additional measures to limit possible exposure and for the safety of our students, staff and community as described below.
Effective immediately and until April 10, 2020 unless further recommendations are made by the Department of Health or more information becomes available, ISD 728 will:

ul.li: Use hospital-grade disinfectant in common areas (i.e. bathrooms, drinking fountains, etc.).
Continue practices related to increased sanitation and wellness strategies.
Change food service operations to limit student touch of utensils and food products with bare hands.
Adjust meal service by providing a modified menu and suspending the use of pin pads by students.
Only allow ISD 728 personnel and contracted partners to enter schools. Visitors and volunteers will not be admitted to schools at this time with the following exception:
Dropoff and pickup procedures for students remain the same, including those involved with Early Childhood and/or EdVenture Club.
Cancel large school related events such as concerts, plays, and assemblies.
Cancel all facility community-use events.
Cancel student out of state travel.
Cancel school field trips.
Adhere to State guidance relating to athletic contests governed by the Minnesota State High School League:Spring Guidance,Website.
Provide alternative formats for parent-teacher conferences scheduled for March 25-27, 2020. Please watch for communication from principals with building specific guidance.
Cancel student recognition events at School Board meetings.
Follow current attendance procedures. Please contact your childs school if you have specific questions related to attendance.

If your child has an underlying condition as identified by theCDCand is believed to be at a greater risk, please consult with your healthcare provider. School nurses, 504 teams, and IEP teams will support individualized student plans.

div.p: In the event an individual associated with ISD 728 was or becomes infected, both the MDH and CDC would contact District administration. MDH would also determine if a health threat existed, who and when to test, and issue directives to the individual and ISD 728 to address the threat. In that situation, ISD 728 officials would modify plans according to the guidance received and communicate information at that time. Currently, the CDC is monitoring, examining and addressing risks of the Coronavirus from those individuals who are entering the United States or who otherwise present a health risk.
The CDC recommends that schools explore the feasibility of social distancing to slow and/or stop the spread of COVID-19. We are exploring and implementing this strategy to the best of our ability.

In the event that the situation changes and we are advised by MDH and MDE to close schools due to COVID-19, ISD 728 will communicate using its inclement weather protocol. Families are encouraged to ensure their contact information is accurate in Infinite Campus to ensure timely communication.
In the event schools are closed, more information about educational services and support will be provided.

ul.li: ACT and MCA testing will continue as planned.

ISD 728 currently has an E-learning Plan that has been approved by the School Board and State. However, per statute, school districts can only use E-Learning for situations related to inclement weather. As a result, the District will continue to develop alternative plans and work with State Officials to explore options such as but not limited to distance learning and staggered schedules.

p.br: Community Education Early Childhood programs, Youth Enrichment and Recreation, Adult Enrichment & Fitness, Adult Basic Education, and EdVenture Club will follow the Districts plan. In the event of a shutdown, programs will be rescheduled and/or families will be provided credit for future programs. Community Education will communicate any program-specific changes with participants.

div.p: School safety remains our top concern, and we will continue to communicate information as the situation unfolds.
Listed below are some links that you may find helpful regarding COVID-19.

a.aria-label: Talking with your children about COVID-19 - Opens a new window

li.a: Talking with your children about COVID-19

a.aria-label: MDH Recommendations for Schools and Child Care - Opens a new window

li.a: MDH Recommendations for Schools and Child Care

a.aria-label: MDH Latest COVID-19 Updates - Opens a new window
Center for Disease Control and Prevention - Opens a new window

li.a: Center for Disease Control and Prevention

a.aria-label: Mental Health and Coping During COVID-19 - Opens a new window

li.a: Mental Health and Coping During COVID-19

div.p: We recognize that during this evolving situation, staff, students and families will experience a significant disruption to the daily routine and experiences in our schools. We appreciate your support as we work through this unprecedented experience in our communities together.

p.span: ISD 728 Families:

In the spirit of our School District mission, we want to continue to provide you with information about our procedures and processes related to COVID-19 or Coronavirus with a 2nd weekly update.
An expanding outbreak of COVID-19 is being experienced in many regions around the world. This is an evolving situation that will undoubtedly have implications for many Minnesota communities in the coming days and weeks, including our own. As a result, ISD 728 Administration is highly involved in planning to prepare for the potential impact of COVID-19.
ISD 728 continues to work closely with the Minnesota Department of Health (MDH) and the Minnesota Department of Education (MDE) as we prepare for what, if any, impact the virus might have on our schools. These two state agencies, in collaboration with the Center for Disease Control (CDC), take the lead on decisions regarding school closures or other impact on schools that could result from outbreaks of contagious conditions, while monitoring local and national health concerns.
We continue to follow the same policy and guidance as we would with other flu and virus outbreaks. We are encouraging those who are ill to stay home, everyone to cover their cough, and all to use good handwashing techniques. In addition, we are asking parents to report symptoms when calling the attendance line to report that your child will be out sick from school. This is an important component to allow us to monitor exposure to contagious illnesses. Here is the protocol for'Is my child well enough to go to school?'due to illness.
TheCDC: Talking with Children about the Coronavirus Disease 2019has additional information for those who are interested in learning more.
As always, our top priority is to keep all staff and students safe.

Dr. Daniel Bittman
ISD 728Superintendent
ISD 728 Families,

In our mission to educate, inspire and empower all learners, the safety of our students, staff and families is among our top priorities. It is in the spirit of our mission that we want to provide you with information about our procedures and processes related to COVID-19 or Coronavirus you have no doubt heard about recently.

ISD 728 is working closely with the Minnesota Department of Health (MDH) and the Minnesota Department of Education (MDE) as we prepare for what, if any, impact the virus might have on our schools.These two state agencies, in collaboration with the Center for Disease Control (CDC), take the lead on decisions regarding school closures or other impact on schools that could result from outbreaks of contagious conditions, while monitoring local and national health concerns.

At this time, ISD 728 is in a prevention stage of managing for a potential outbreak. That means we are using standards and practices already in place for any illness outbreak, such as influenza(flu) or stomach virus. Key members of the District leadership team have met and will continue to meet to prepare for any events that require a district-wide response. Also, each school is using protocols to prevent the spread of any germs such as hand washing, cleaning, and encouraging those who are sick to stay home.

span.strong: What can you do at this time?
span.br: The MDH encourages everyone to follow the same practices used during cold and flu season:

li.span: Wash your hands for 20 seconds. The tune Happy Birthday should be sung twice.
Cover your cough or sneeze.
Stay home when you are sick. Work with school personnel if you are experiencing a prolonged illness.
Keep children home from after school clubs or activities when they are sick.

p.span: TheCDCand theMinnesota Department of Healthhave more information for those who are interested in learning more.
We will continue to communicate information as it becomes available and as we learn more. Thank you for being a part of ISD 728.

Dan Bittman,
ISD 728Superintendent

p.span: The District encourages students, staff members and volunteers to begin the following measures to avoid contracting the COVID-19 and avoiding the spread of it if they unknowingly have it:

li.span: Washing hands frequently with soap and water for 20 seconds.
Covering their coughs by coughing into their armnot hands.
Staying home when sick. Work with school personnel if you are experiencing prolonged illness.
Keep children home from after school clubs or activities when they are sick.
Avoiding touching their face with unwashed hands.
Hand-shakes and touching of each other should be discouraged.
Touching uncleaned objects (like door handles and faucet handles) with clean hands should become an issue of awareness.

p.br: Additional steps the District will take to help prevent the spread of the COVID-19:

li.span: Although ISD 728 already does regular cleaning and disinfecting of surfaces throughout each school on a regular basis, the level of cleaning and disinfecting will be accelerated in common spaces and classrooms of every school.
Classroom use of disinfecting cleaning wipes are encouraged so students and staff can keep their hands and work surfaces clean.
Parents are asked to encourage their children to use wipes and hand sanitizers when available.
There is currently a national shortage of appropriate masks, but efforts will be made to access what is available for student and employee use during the school day.

p.strong: Monitoring the health condition of students, employees and family members:

li.span: As always, ISD 728 is asking parents to work with them to help prevent any spread of contagious illnesses including COVID-19. ISD 728 requests the immediate notification of any family member who exhibits symptoms of fever, cough and shortness of breath, that could impact students or staff members.

However,Minnesota Department of Health(MDH) has primary responsibility for the overall monitoring of Minnesota residents who may be exposed to COVID-19, and they would inform ISD 728 of steps they expect the District to implement.

b.br: Identification of Coronavirus presence in a student, employee or family member:

b.span: MDH will have primary responsibility for managing the existence of COVID-19 in any student, employee or family member; and the District will cooperate fully.

h1.aria-label: Determining if a School Will Close as a Result of COVID-19
h1.span: Determining if a School Will Close as a Result of COVID-19

p.span: Minnesota Department of Health(MDH) will contact ISD 728 if a particular school or schools should be closed due to confirmed cases of COVID-19. The decision to close would involve the Minnesota Department of Education (MDE) and MDH, and the District would be responsible for implementing the closure. In each of those situations, the Department of Health would decide the need for quarantining people on a case-by-case basis.
In case a decision to close a school or all schools in ISD 728 has been made by MDH or the District itself, instruction for all students and staff will be provided.
